subject: AI
title: Multimodal Models
description: When LLMs understand images, audio, and video alongside text.

hook.text: You upload a photo of a restaurant receipt and ask 'What did I order and what's the total?' The model reads the receipt, extracts items, and adds them up. Text + vision in one call.

buildup.text: Multimodal models accept multiple input types ‚Äî text, images, audio, video ‚Äî and reason across them. GPT-4o, Gemini, and Claude 3 all support text + image at minimum.

discovery.text: This unlocks tasks that were impossible with text-only models: analyzing charts, reading handwriting, describing scenes, generating images from descriptions.

twist.text: Vision capabilities are still uneven. Models handle clear photos well but struggle with handwriting, low-resolution images, or complex diagrams. Don't assume pixel-perfect understanding.

climax.text: Multimodal is the direction. Text-only models are increasingly the exception. Design your applications to take advantage of multiple input types.

punchline.text: The model can see, read, and soon hear. The interface to AI is no longer just a text box.

quiz.question: What makes a model multimodal?
options: It can run on multiple devices
It accepts and reasons across multiple input types like text, images, and audio
It was trained by multiple companies
